cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SSW of Great Exuma Island, or about 370 miles ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest along or just north of eastern-central Cuba, forecast to turn northwest toward the Florida Keys Saturday, then north toward the northeast Gulf Coast (Florida Big Bend / far eastern Panhandle) late Sunday into Monday, before curving inland across Alabamaâ€“Tennessee by Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / eastern Florida Panhandle coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of Ciego de Avila, Camaguey, Las Tunas, Holguin and Granma; southwest coast of Florida from Englewood southward and eastward to Ocean Reef
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, Bahamas, Florida Keys, southwest and west coast of Florida, northeastern Gulf Coast (Big Bend / Panhandle), then inland Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (below 4 inches expected this far north)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (non-tidal freshwater port on Lake Erie)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible mid-week (generally below tropical-storm force)
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain possible mid-week as remnant moisture moves into the Ohio Valley, but flooding threat currently low for Cleveland
